skill.name: research-fact-checker
skill.description: Assists authors in researching topics, verifying facts, and ensuring accuracy in their writing. Particularly useful for historical fiction, non-fiction, science fiction, and any genre requiring real-world accuracy. Use when the user needs help with research or fact-checking.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown instructions and templates for research methodology. No file access, network calls, command execution, or environment variable access detected.

content.user_title: Verify facts and research for your writing
content.value_statement: Authors often struggle to verify factual accuracy in their fiction writing. This skill provides structured research frameworks and fact-checking methodologies to help ensure accuracy in historical, scientific, and cultural details.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured research plans for historical, scientific, cultural, and professional topics
Develops fact-checking reports that identify and correct inaccuracies in manuscripts
Provides templates for organizing sources, tracking research notes, and maintaining bibliographies
Offers guidance on integrating research naturally into narrative without info-dumping
Identifies anachronisms and suggests period-appropriate alternatives
Evaluates source reliability and cross-references claims against multiple sources
limitations: Does not access external databases or perform live internet searches
Cannot verify real-time information or current events
Does not provide legal or medical advice
Cannot access or read the user's local files directly

use_cases.title: Period-Accurate Details
use_cases.description: Research historical periods to ensure accurate clothing, customs, technology, and social norms in your historical fiction.

use_cases.title: Fact Verification
use_cases.description: Verify claims and statistics in your non-fiction work against reliable sources before publication.

use_cases.title: Scientific Plausibility
use_cases.description: Check scientific accuracy of speculative elements in your sci-fi to maintain credibility with readers.

prompt_templates.title: Historical Research Request
prompt_templates.prompt: I am writing a [genre] set in [time period] in [location]. My protagonist is a [character description]. What specific historical details should I research for authenticity?

prompt_templates.title: Fact-Check Passage
prompt_templates.prompt: Please fact-check this passage from my [chapter/section]: [paste text]. Identify any claims that need verification and suggest corrections for any inaccuracies.

prompt_templates.title: Cultural Accuracy Review
prompt_templates.prompt: I am writing about [culture/time period] and want to ensure cultural accuracy. What common misconceptions should I avoid and what reliable sources should I consult?

prompt_templates.title: Scientific Accuracy Check
prompt_templates.prompt: I wrote this [scene/description] about [scientific topic]: [paste text]. Is this scientifically accurate? If not, please explain the errors and provide correct information.

best_practices: Start research early in your writing process rather than during the first draft
Document all sources with publication dates and author credentials for future reference
Use the iceberg principle: know 90% of your research but only show 10% in your writing
anti_patterns: Including paragraphs of facts without weaving them into character perspective or narrative
Relying on a single source for important claims without cross-referencing
Ignoring anachronisms that break reader immersion in period fiction

faq.question: Does this skill search the internet for me?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides methodology and frameworks. You conduct the actual research using the guidance provided.

faq.question: What topics does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Historical, scientific, cultural, and professional research across fiction and non-fiction genres.

faq.question: Can I use this with my existing manuscript?
faq.answer: Yes. Paste your text and the skill will extract claims, verify them, and suggest corrections.

faq.question: Is my writing data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes text you provide during your session. No data is stored or shared.

faq.question: Why are my facts marked as inaccurate?
faq.answer: The skill compares your claims against established knowledge. If you believe information is correct, verify with additional authoritative sources.

faq.question: How is this different from a search engine?
faq.answer: This skill provides research frameworks, templates, and fact-checking methodology rather than raw information.
